'''Babubhai V. Shah''' (born 6 February 1935), professor of statistics, was a chief scientist at [[Research Triangle Institute]] (RTI) from 1966 till he retired in 2003. He held several positions with RTI and [[Research Triangle Park]] for over four decades. B. V. Shah was responsible for the development of the [[SUDAAN]] software;<ref>[CITATION] SUDAAN user's manual, release 7.5 BV Shah, BG Barnwell, GS Bieler - Research Triangle Park, NC: Research Triangle …, 1997
- Related articles</ref> to recognize his contributions, RTI has dedicated the current release of SUDAAN (9.0) to B. V. Shah. During that time, he was also part of the academia of biostatistics department, [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]], N.C.

Shah received his Ph.D. in statistics from [[University of Mumbai]] in 1960 under the guidance of professor [[M. C. Chakrabarti]].<ref>[http://www.mu.ac.in/science/Statistics/alumni.html Shah's Ph.D. from statistics department of the University of Mumbai]</ref>

==Honors==

* American Statistical Association, Fellow
* [[International Statistical Institute]], Fellow
* Royal Statistical Society, Fellow
